intro: Androsace tribracteata, commonly known as the three-bract androsace, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically reaches a height of 5–10 centimeters. The plant features rosettes of hairy, oval-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white or pink. It is native to mountainous regions of Europe and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
